intro: Amarella monantha, commonly known as the common amarella, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters during late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped, alternate, and have a slightly serrated edge. Amarella monantha is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
